head.title: Teachers Are Teachers No Matter Their Race

hedline.hl1: Teachers Are Teachers No Matter Their Race

block.p: Re ''White Faces at the Blackboard: Despite Efforts by the State, Classrooms Still Lack Minority Teachers'' (June 11):
Re ''White Faces at the Blackboard: Despite Efforts by the State, Classrooms Still Lack Minority Teachers'' (June 11):

Teachers are teachers regardless of color or anything else. My wife taught for 24 years and I volunteer as a tutor in Bridgeport. We are both retired. I find the problem less a problem than your article makes it: if a teacher is qualified then that teacher should be examined along with all other qualified applicants. A signing bonus for only minority applicants is discrimination in and of itself. There should be one criterion only: is the individual qualified to be considered along with other qualified applicants?
